page.title: 10Tourism;what to see and do
page.content: For the tourist,Wolsingham can be a base for wider exploration in{Weardale or over into{Hamsterley Forest.}The area itself offers{attractive walks}by the River Wear,along the many streams and public rights of way. The town includes{listed buildings such as Whitfield House,Bombay House Fawnlees Hall and Baal Hill Farm. {Guided walks,}led by Mr George Lister,a local historian,take place in summer. Such a tour will reveal the variety and extent of small_scale industry that survived until the coming of the railway. Walking on the high ground offords {panoramic views}of the area and opportunity to see the extensive wild life.{Ancient boundaries,}like the Long Dyke,and the remains of mill races and their dams can still be found.
